thread.title: Ashes 2015 score: updates from the Third Test in Edgbaston, day 3 | The
thread.title_full: Ashes 2015 score: News updates from the Third Test in Edgbaston, day 3 | The Advertiser

author: JAI BEDNALL
title: Ashes 2015 score: updates from the Third Test in Edgbaston, day 3 | The
text:
Follow our live coverage of day three of the third Ashes Test at Edgbaston.
It’s a mostly sunny day in Birmingham with an expected top temperature of 19C. Play is scheduled to start at 8pm AEST.
8.10pm — NEVILL POSTS HALF CENTURY
Peter Nevill is justifying his selection. Source: AP
PETER Nevill has passed 50 as Australia makes a bright start to day three.
Nevill (53 not out) and Mitchell Starc (15 not out) have added 24 runs from the first three overs this morning to take the Aussies’ lead to 47 runs.
Scroll down for over-by-over coverage
7.30pm — ANDERSON RULED OUT OF FOURTH TEST
Australia will be hoping this was the last time James Anderson touches a cricket ball in this series. Source: AFP
ENGLAND pace ace James Anderson has been ruled out for the remainder of this Test match — and the fourth Test at Trent Bridge next week.
Anderson badly strained his side while bowling late on day two and it is unknown whether he will bat if Australia pulls off a miracle and sets a target it’s able to defend today.
“Obviously it’s going to be a big loss for them, but we’ve seen what Steven Finn can do,” Aussie batsman David Warner said.
“Look what he did today, produced a fantastic spell. We know what Woody is capable of as well, so they’ve got bowling stocks.
“For us, we’ve got to worry about scoring runs. What happens in their camp is in their camp.”
JUST IN: James Anderson ruled out of the remainder of the third Test, as well as the fourth Test, due to a side strain #Ashes
— cricket.com.au (@CricketAus) July 31, 2015 Stuart Broad tells Sky that Anderson will miss Trent Bridge but is very hopeful he'll be back for 5th #Ashes Test @surreycricket #Ashes2015
— CricketBadger (@cricket_badger) July 31, 2015 The Aussies begin day three at 7/168 in their second innings with a lead of 23 runs. Peter Nevill (37 from 117 balls) and Mitchell Starc (7 from 29 balls) carry the hopes of the visitors.
Anderson’s absence means Stuart Broad and Steven Finn will open the bowling today and look for the quick kill.
— with News Corp’s Ben Horne
Day 3 - Third Ashes Test (Frame content direct link: http://embed.scribblelive.com/Embed/v7.aspx?Id=1404372&ThemeId=27311 .)
Originally published as Live: Huge blow for England
